text.*:
1990 Arab Club Champions Cup
بطولة الأندية العربية لأبطال الدوري 1990
Cancelled
← 1989
1992 →

The 1990 Arab Club Champions Cup is a tournament held between Arab clubs by UAFA. The preliminary round began, but the final tournament was cancelled because of the Gulf War.

Contents

  • 1 Preliminary round
    • 1.1 Zone 1 (Gulf Area)
    • 1.2 Zone 2 (Red Sea)
    • 1.3 Zone 3 (North Africa)
    • 1.4 Zone 4 (East Region)
  • 2 Final tournament
  • 3 External links

Preliminary round[edit]

Zone 1 (Gulf Area)[edit]

This section is empty. You can help by adding to it. (May 2015)

Zone 3 (North Africa)[edit]

This section needs expansion. You can help by adding to it. (May 2015)
Team 1 Agg. Team 2 1st leg 2nd leg
MC Alger 2–1 Étoile du Sahel 1–0 1–1
MC Alger 1 – 0 Étoile du Sahel
Maza  –'
Stade 5 Juillet, Algiers
Étoile du Sahel 1 – 1 MC Alger
–  –' (o.g.) Guettouche  –'
Stade Olympique de Sousse, Sousse

MC Alger advanced to the final tournament.

Zone 4 (East Region)[edit]

Preliminary round tournament held in Amman, Jordan from 7 to 15 July 1990.

Team Pld W D L GF GA GD Pts
Al-Faisaly 2 1 1 0 4 0 +4 3
Al-Zawra'a 2 1 1 0 2 0 +2 3
Haifa SC 2 0 0 2 0 6 -6 0
7 july 1990
Al-Faisaly 4 – 0 Haifa SC
Amman International Stadium, Amman
11 july 1990
Al-Faisaly 0 – 0 Al-Zawra'a
Amman International Stadium, Amman
15 july 1990
Al-Zawra'a 2 – 0 Haifa SC
Abdelwahed  –', –'
Amman International Stadium, Amman

Al-Faisaly and Al-Zawra'a advanced to the final tournament.

Final tournament[edit]

The final tournament was cancelled because Gulf War.
